page.title: 03BEEF REARING
page.content: All the farms in the area keep some beef cattle, often in the form of suckler calves which run with their mothers on farms where the cows are not kept for milk.From the end of October they are mainly taken indoors for the Winter and fed on hay, silage and corn until the warmer weather of Spring gets the grass growing again. Increasingly, the faster fattening breeds such as Charolais and Limousin are being kept and they cannot take the cold weather.Even if his cattle stay out, the farmer still has to feed them in the fields as there is not enough grass growth to fatten them.
